reference.title: OpenStack Variables
reference.shortdesc: You must configure a number of OpenStack variables in order to run Neutron and Nova command-line interface (CLI) commands to create your sandbox environment. You can create and configure an openrc.sh file by obtaining the values of these variables from your administrator or by using the Horizon web console.

row.entry: The address of the Identity API served through keystone
The name of a region in a multi-region configurationDo not leave this variable blank. Unset it if it is empty.
The ID of the entity that owns resources

example.title: A sample openrc.sh file
example.codeblock:
export OS_AUTH_URL=http://198.51.100.0:5000/v2.0
export OS_TENANT_ID=a12345678b9c0d12ef3g45h678i90123 export OS_TENANT_NAME="myTenant" export OS_PROJECT_NAME="myProject"
export OS_USERNAME="myUsername"
echo "Please enter your OpenStack password: " read -sr OS_PASSWORD_INPUT export OS_PASSWORD=$OS_PASSWORD_INPUT
export OS_REGION_NAME="myRegionName" if [ -z "$OS_REGION_NAME" ]; then unset OS_REGION_NAME; fi

example.title: A sample openrc.bat file
example.codeblock:
set OS_AUTH_URL=http://198.51.100.0:5000/v2.0
set OS_TENANT_ID=a12345678b9c0d12ef3g45h678i90123 set OS_TENANT_NAME=myTenant set OS_PROJECT_NAME=myProject
set OS_USERNAME=myUsername
set /p OS_PASSWORD_INPUT=Please enter your OpenStack password: set OS_PASSWORD=%OS_PASSWORD_INPUT%
set OS_REGION_NAME=myRegionNameIf the variable is empty, then unset the variable.
